paragraphs.text:
%angular

TMDB 5000 Movie Dataset

Metadata on ~5,000 movies from TMDb
Source: Kaggle TMDB Movie Dataset

Background:
What can we say about the success of a movie before it is released? Are there certain companies (Pixar?) that have found a consistent formula? Given that major films costing over $100 million to produce can still flop, this question is more important than ever to the industry. Film aficionados might have different interests. Can we predict which films will be highly rated, whether or not they are a commercial success?

Analysis Goals:
The goal of this notebook is to demonstrate basic Spark text analytics against a set of unstructured data (movie title and movie overview). The results of the text analysis can tehn be paired with structured data (film budget, release date, runtime, etc) to predict movie revenue by implementing a machine learning model.

paragraphs.title: Load Rawdata
paragraphs.text:
%pyspark

############################################################################################################
#
#   Load Rawdata
#   Source: https://www.kaggle.com/tmdb/tmdb-movie-metadata
#
############################################################################################################

schema = StructType([                                           \
    StructField("budget", IntegerType(), True),                 \
    StructField("genres", StringType(), True),                  \
    StructField("homepage", StringType(), True),                \
    StructField("id", StringType(), True),                      \
    StructField("keywords", StringType(), True),                \
    StructField("original_language", StringType(), True),       \
    StructField("original_title", StringType(), True),          \
    StructField("overview", StringType(), True),                \
    StructField("popularity", FloatType(), True),               \
    StructField("production_companies", StringType(), True),    \
    StructField("production_countries", StringType(), True),    \
    StructField("release_date", StringType(), True),            \
    StructField("revenue", LongType(), True),                   \
    StructField("runtime", IntegerType(), True),                \
    StructField("spoken_languages", StringType(), True),        \
    StructField("status", StringType(), True),                  \
    StructField("tagline", StringType(), True),                 \
    StructField("title", StringType(), True),                   \
    StructField("vote_average", FloatType(), True),             \
    StructField("vote_count", IntegerType(), True)])

rawdata = spark.read.load('hdfs://dzaratsian0.field.hortonworks.com:8020/tmp/tmdb_5000_movies.csv', 
    format="csv", 
    header=True, 
    schema=schema, 
    inferSchema=False, 
    quote='"', 
    escape='"', 
    mode="DROPMALFORMED")

print("Number of records in rawdata: " + str(rawdata.count()))

rawdata.createOrReplaceTempView('rawdata')

paragraphs.title: Extract Genre from JSON
Model Transformations (Extract Date Vars)
Derive Data-Driven Topics
paragraphs.text:
%pyspark

############################################################################################################
#
#   Data-Driven Topics
#
############################################################################################################

number_of_clusters = 25

def handle_encoding(text):
    return "".join(i for i in text if ord(i)<128)

udf_handle_encoding = udf(handle_encoding, StringType())
clean_text = enriched2.withColumn("overview", udf_handle_encoding('overview')) \
                      .withColumn("title", udf_handle_encoding('title'))

def cleanup_text(text):
    words = text.split()
    
    # Default list of Stopwords
    stopwords_core = ['a', u'about', u'above', u'after', u'again', u'against', u'all', u'am', u'an', u'and', u'any', u'are', u'arent', u'as', u'at', 
    u'be', u'because', u'been', u'before', u'being', u'below', u'between', u'both', u'but', u'by', 
    u'can', 'cant', 'come', u'could', 'couldnt', 
    u'd', u'did', u'didn', u'do', u'does', u'doesnt', u'doing', u'dont', u'down', u'during', 
    u'each', 
    u'few', 'finally', u'for', u'from', u'further', 
    u'had', u'hadnt', u'has', u'hasnt', u'have', u'havent', u'having', u'he', u'her', u'here', u'hers', u'herself', u'him', u'himself', u'his', u'how', 
    u'i', u'if', u'in', u'into', u'is', u'isnt', u'it', u'its', u'itself', 
    u'just', 
    u'll', 
    u'm', u'many', u'me', u'might', u'more', u'most', u'must', u'my', u'myself', 
    u'no', u'nor', u'not', u'now', 
    u'o', u'of', u'off', u'on', u'once', u'only', u'or', u'other', u'our', u'ours', u'ourselves', u'out', u'over', u'own', 
    u'r', u're', 
    u's', 'said', u'same', u'she', u'should', u'shouldnt', u'so', u'some', u'such', 
    u't', u'than', u'that', 'thats', u'the', u'their', u'theirs', u'them', u'themselves', u'then', u'there', u'these', u'they', u'this', u'those', u'through', u'to', u'too',
    u'under', u'until', u'up',
    u'very', 
    u'was', u'wasnt', u'we', u'were', u'werent', u'what', u'when', u'where', u'which', u'while', u'who', u'whom', u'why', u'will', u'with', u'wont', u'would', 
    u'y', u'you', u'your', u'yours', u'yourself', u'yourselves']
    
    # Custom List of Stopwords - Add your own here
    stopwords_custom = ['']
    stopwords = stopwords_core + stopwords_custom
    stopwords = [word.lower() for word in stopwords]    
    
    words_out = [re.sub('[^a-zA-Z0-9]','',word) for word in words]                                       # Remove special characters
    words_out = [word.lower() for word in words_out if len(word)>2 and word.lower() not in stopwords]     # Remove stopwords and words under X length
    return words_out

udf_cleantext = udf(cleanup_text , ArrayType(StringType()))
clean_text2   = clean_text.withColumn("words", udf_cleantext('overview'))

# Term Frequency Vectorization
cv = CountVectorizer(inputCol="words", outputCol="rawFeatures", vocabSize = 1000)
cvmodel = cv.fit(clean_text2)
featurizedData = cvmodel.transform(clean_text2)

vocab = cvmodel.vocabulary
vocab_broadcast = sc.broadcast(vocab)

idf = IDF(inputCol="rawFeatures", outputCol="features")
idfModel = idf.fit(featurizedData)
rescaledData = idfModel.transform(featurizedData)

# LDA Clustering - Find Data-driven Topics
lda = LDA(k=number_of_clusters, seed=123, optimizer="em", featuresCol="features")

ldamodel = lda.fit(rescaledData)

#ldamodel.isDistributed()
#ldamodel.vocabSize()

ldatopics = ldamodel.describeTopics()
#ldatopics.show(number_of_clusters)

def map_termID_to_Word(termIndices):
    words = []
    for termID in termIndices:
        words.append(vocab_broadcast.value[termID])
    
    return words

udf_map_termID_to_Word = udf(map_termID_to_Word , ArrayType(StringType()))
ldatopics_mapped = ldatopics.withColumn("topic_desc", udf_map_termID_to_Word(ldatopics.termIndices))
ldatopics_mapped.select(ldatopics_mapped.topic, ldatopics_mapped.topic_desc).show(number_of_clusters,False)

ldaResults = ldamodel.transform(rescaledData)

#ldaResults.show()

# Breakout LDA Topics for Modeling and Reporting
def breakout_array(index_number, record):
    vectorlist = record.tolist()
    return vectorlist[index_number]

udf_breakout_array = udf(breakout_array, FloatType())

for index_number in range(number_of_clusters):
    column_name  = "Topic_" + str(index_number)
    ldaResults = ldaResults.withColumn(column_name, udf_breakout_array(lit(index_number), ldaResults.topicDistribution))          

text_enriched = ldaResults.drop('words','rawFeatures','features','topicDistribution')

text_enriched.createOrReplaceTempView('text_enriched')

paragraphs.title: Sentiment Analysis:  -1 (Negative) to 1 (Positive)
paragraphs.text:
%pyspark

def zsentiment(text):
    return TextBlob(text).sentiment.polarity

udf_zsentiment = udf(zsentiment , FloatType())
text_variable = 'overview'
text_enriched = text_enriched.withColumn("sentiment_score", udf_zsentiment( text_enriched[text_variable] ))
text_enriched.select('id','title','revenue','sentiment_score').show(15,False)

paragraphs.title: Random Split Dataset (Training & Testing)
paragraphs.text:
%pyspark

# Handle Null/Missing values
modelprep = text_enriched.na.fill(-1)

training, testing = modelprep.randomSplit([0.80, 0.20], seed=12345)

print('Total Records:     ' + str(modelprep.count()))
print('Training Records:  ' + str(training.count()))
print('Testing Records:   ' + str(testing.count()))

msg.data:
Total Records:     3375
Training Records:  2643
Testing Records:   732

paragraphs.title: Train Predictive Model
paragraphs.text:
%pyspark

target   = 'revenue_over_100M'
features = ['budget','runtime','vote_average','vote_count','year','month','day','genre_index','sentiment_score'] + ["Topic_" + str(index_number) for index_number in range(number_of_clusters)]

# Bucketize revenue (split at $100M)
revenue_splits     = [-float("inf"), 100000000, float("inf")]
revenue_bucketizer = Bucketizer(splits=revenue_splits, inputCol="revenue", outputCol="revenue_over_100M")

# SI on genre
si  = StringIndexer(inputCol="genre", outputCol="genre_index")

# Vectorizer
va  = VectorAssembler(inputCols=features, outputCol="features")

# ML Models
gbc = GBTClassifier(featuresCol="features", labelCol=target, predictionCol="prediction", maxDepth=5, maxBins=32, maxIter=20, seed=12345)
rfc = RandomForestClassifier(featuresCol="features", labelCol=target, predictionCol="prediction", probabilityCol="probability", numTrees=10, maxDepth=5, seed=12345)

# Build Pipeline
pipeline = Pipeline(stages=[revenue_bucketizer, si, va, gbc])

mlmodel_with_text = pipeline.fit(training)

paragraphs.title: Model Evaluation
paragraphs.text:
%pyspark

def evaluate_regression_model(model, test_df, label='label'):
    predictions = model.transform(test_df)
    #predictions.select(label, "prediction").show(30,False)
    
    evaluator = RegressionEvaluator(metricName="rmse")  # rmse (default)|mse|r2|mae
    RMSE = evaluator.evaluate(predictions)
    print 'RMSE: ' + str(RMSE)
    
    evaluator = RegressionEvaluator(metricName="r2")
    R2 = evaluator.evaluate(predictions)
    print 'R2:   ' + str(R2)
    
    return predictions

def evaluate_classification_model(model, test_df, label='label'):
    predictions = model.transform(test_df)
    #predictions.select("prediction", label).show(30,False)
    
    # Select (prediction, true label) and compute test error
    evaluator = MulticlassClassificationEvaluator(labelCol=label, predictionCol="prediction", metricName="accuracy")   # f1|weightedPrecision|weightedRecall|accuracy
    accuracy = evaluator.evaluate(predictions)
    print("Accuracy: " + str(accuracy))
    
    return accuracy, predictions


# Predictions
accuracy_with_text, predictions_with_text = evaluate_classification_model(mlmodel_with_text, testing, label=target)

print('\nAccuracy for Gradient Boosting (with text):  ' + str(accuracy_with_text))

predictions_with_text.select('id','title','sentiment_score','revenue','revenue_over_100M','prediction','probability').sort(predictions_with_text.id).show(50,False)

paragraphs.title: Model Feature Importances
paragraphs.text:
%pyspark

feature_importance_vars = sorted([(features[i],feature) for i,feature in enumerate(mlmodel_with_text.stages[-1].featureImportances)], key=lambda x: x[1], reverse=True)

print('Feature Importances (descending):')
for f in feature_importance_vars:
    print(f)
